elements_required: Dishonestly appropriates property belonging to another
With intention permanently to deprive the other of it
section_1_theft.punishment: Maximum 7 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine
process_steps: Trial in Magistrates' Court or Crown Court
Sentencing based on culpability and harm

elements_required: Accompanied by force or threat of force
Used to steal or immediately after stealing
Entry to building or part of building as trespasser
With intent to steal, inflict grievous bodily harm, or do unlawful damage
process_steps: Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court

elements_required: Knowing or believing it to be stolen
process_steps: Prosecution for money laundering if applicable

elements_required: Intention that victim acts on representation
Victim acts on representation to own detriment
section_1_fraud_by_false_representation.punishment: Maximum 10 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine
process_steps: Financial investigation by police or FCA
Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court
Confiscation proceedings under Proceeds of Crime Act

section_2_fraud_by_failure_to_disclose.offence: Fraud by Failing to Disclose Information
elements_required: Intention to make gain or cause loss
section_2_fraud_by_failure_to_disclose.punishment: Maximum 10 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine
process_steps: Complex fraud trials in Crown Court

elements_required: Intention to make gain or cause loss
section_3_fraud_by_abuse_of_position.punishment: Maximum 10 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine
process_steps: Investigation by police or regulatory bodies

section_18_wounding_with_intent.offence: Wounding with Intent to Cause Grievous Bodily Harm
elements_required: With intent to cause grievous bodily harm
Or with intent to resist arrest
Unlawfully and maliciously wounds or causes grievous bodily harm
Without intent to cause such harm
section_20_malicious_wounding.punishment: Maximum 5 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine
process_steps: Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court

elements_required: Intentionally or recklessly causes another to apprehend immediate unlawful violence
section_39_common_assault.punishment: Maximum 6 months imprisonment and/or fine up to £5,000
process_steps: Conditional discharge common for first offenses

elements_required: Intentionally penetrates vagina, anus or mouth with penis
Without reasonable belief that victim consented
process_steps: Sentencing based on culpability and harm

elements_required: Penetrates vagina or anus with object or body part

process_steps: Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court

section_4_production_and_supply.offence: Production or Supply of Controlled Drugs
elements_required: Knowing or believing it to be controlled drug
section_4_production_and_supply.punishment: Up to life imprisonment depending on drug class and quantity

section_5_possession.punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment depending on drug class
process_steps: Police stop and search or arrest
Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court

elements_required: Intention to secure access to program or data
Access unauthorised and known to be unauthorised
section_1_unauthorised_access.punishment: Maximum 2 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine
process_steps: Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court

section_2_unauthorised_access_with_inten.offence: Unauthorised Access with Further Criminal Intent
elements_required: Or intent to facilitate commission of further offence
section_2_unauthorised_access_with_inten.punishment: Maximum 5 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine

section_3_unauthorised_modification.offence: Unauthorised Acts with Intent to Impair
elements_required: Intent to impair operation of computer
Intent to prevent or hinder access to computer
Intent to impair operation of program or data
section_3_unauthorised_modification.punishment: Maximum 10 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine

process_steps: Trial in Magistrates' or Crown Court

elements_required: Driving or attempting to drive motor vehicle
Alcohol level above legal limit (80mg/100ml blood or 35mcg/100ml breath)
section_4_driving_with_excess_alcohol.punishment: Maximum 6 months imprisonment, £5,000 fine, and disqualification

section_14_implied_terms.offence: Breach of Implied Terms - Satisfactory Quality
process_steps: Inform seller of breach within reasonable time

elements_required: Term causes significant imbalance between parties
process_steps: Injunction to prevent use of unfair terms

elements_required: Goods or services purchased on credit
process_steps: Claim against credit card company within 6 months

section_13_satisfactory_quality.offence: Services Not Carried Out with Reasonable Skill
elements_required: Services not performed with reasonable care and skill
Court must consider child's welfare as paramount
process_steps: CAFCASS (Children and Family Court Advisory Service) involvement

elements_required: Dispute about where child lives or spends time
Best interests of child paramount consideration
process_steps: Court application under Part 19 Family Procedure Rules
Fact-finding hearing if domestic abuse alleged
Decree absolute after 6 weeks (or 3 months if contested)

elements_required: Fair distribution based on needs and contributions

civil_remedies: Power of arrest attached to orders
process_steps: Without notice application in urgent cases
On notice application with 2 weeks' notice

elements_required: Factual possession of registered land for 10 years
Possession must be adverse to paper owner
civil_remedies: Registration of title in squatter's name

elements_required: Dismissal not for potentially fair reason
civil_remedies: Compensation up to statutory maximum (£93,878 for 2024/25)

elements_required: No genuine redundancy or improper procedure
civil_remedies: Compensation based on age, length of service, weekly pay

elements_required: Protected characteristic (age, sex, race, disability, etc.)
Less favourable treatment because of protected characteristic
PCP disadvantages people with protected characteristic
Worker entitled to 24 hours' uninterrupted rest per week
Employer fails to provide rest period
civil_remedies: Payment for work during rest period (double time)
process_steps: Report to Health and Safety Executive

elements_required: Entitled to 5.6 weeks' paid annual leave
Employer refuses to allow leave or pay for untaken leave
Defendant owed claimant duty of care
process_steps: Court proceedings in County Court or High Court

elements_required: Statement lowers claimant in estimation of right-thinking people
No defence available (truth, privilege, honest opinion, etc.)
process_steps: County Court or High Court proceedings

elements_required: Unlawful interference with claimant's use of land
Direct physical interference with claimant's land

article_3_prohibition_of_torture.offence: Protection from Torture and Inhuman Treatment
elements_required: Protection from inhuman and degrading treatment
Right to be informed of reasons
Right to compensation for unlawful detention

process_steps: Application to European Court of Human Rights

article_8_right_to_private_life.offence: Right to Private and Family Life

elements_required: Freedom to receive and impart information
Restrictions must be prescribed by law

civil_remedies: Erasure of data (right to be forgotten)

article_17_right_to_erasure.offence: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)

elements_required: Causation link between breach and damage
Without leave to enter or remain
Passenger does not have entry clearance
civil_remedies: Civil penalties up to £2,000 per passenger

elements_required: Premises in such state as to be prejudicial to health
Unreasonable interference with enjoyment of premises

civil_remedies: Return of goods or money paid

process_steps: Court proceedings if tenant doesn't leave

elements_required: Duty to act in good faith
Making copies for sale or hire
section_60_criminal_offences.punishment: Up to 10 years imprisonment and/or unlimited fine

elements_required: Bolam test: would reasonable body of professionals agree
Grant of probate or letters of administration
Duty to collect and preserve estate
Duty to pay debts and taxes
Duty to distribute according to will/intestacy
Failure to act in beneficiaries' interests
Cannot be cared for by birth parents
No parent consent or consent dispensed with
